workflow.name: Add MailPoet subscribers from WordPress forms via TWZ plugin and log to Google Sheets
workflow.description:
What Is TWZ n8n MailPoet Integration?

This workflow adds subscribers to MailPoet using n8n by bridging WordPress through a custom REST API and logging results in Google Sheets.

MailPoet is a popular WordPress email marketing plugin, but it does not provide a public REST API. Because of this limitation, n8n cannot connect to MailPoet directly using native nodes or standard integrations.

This workflow demonstrates a practical and production-ready solution for connecting n8n ‚Üí WordPress ‚Üí MailPoet using a custom WordPress REST API plugin called [TWZ N8N MailPoet](https://themewizz.com/product/twz-n8n-mailpoet-add-subscriber-api/).

üöß Problem This Workflow Solves

‚ùå MailPoet has no public REST API
‚ùå n8n cannot add MailPoet subscribers natively
‚ùå External forms and automations cannot push data into MailPoet

‚úÖ Solution Architecture

This workflow solves the problem by:

Creating a secure REST API endpoint inside WordPress

Using an n8n HTTP Request node to send subscriber data

Adding subscribers directly to MailPoet

Preventing duplicate subscribers

Logging subscribers in Google Sheets for visibility

This creates a reliable bridge between n8n and MailPoet, enabling automation workflows that were previously not possible.

üîå How It Works (High Level)

üì• n8n receives form submission data
üîç The workflow checks if the subscriber already exists
üìß The subscriber is added to MailPoet via the custom REST API
üìä Subscriber data is logged in Google Sheets
‚úÖ The workflow returns a success or error response

üéØ Why This Workflow Is Useful

Works around MailPoet‚Äôs missing API

Enables full automation from external tools

Uses standard n8n nodes (HTTP Request, IF, Google Sheets)

Secure and reusable integration pattern

Ideal for WordPress-based businesses

üß© About the TWZ n8n MailPoet Plugin

TWZ n8n MailPoet is a free, lightweight WordPress plugin designed to provide a simple and reliable integration between n8n (or any external service) and MailPoet.

It implements a single MailPoet API operation:
‚û° Add Subscriber

This keeps the plugin lightweight, fast, and focused.

parameters.content:
## Trigger: Form Submission
This node listens to your WordPress form submission.
It collects the following fields:
- First Name
- Last Name
- Email

## Check Existing Subscribers
This node checks your Google Sheet or MailPoet API to see if the subscriber already exists.
This helps avoid duplicate entries in MailPoet.

## Conditional Branch: IF Node
- If subscriber does not exist ‚Üí Add subscriber via HTTP Request node
- If subscriber exists ‚Üí Skip to completion message
This ensures that new users are only added once.
- Add users to subscribers 
- Logs the subscriber data into Google Sheet

## Logging & Completion
- Sends the completion message to the user (‚ÄúThank you for your review!‚Äù)
Optional: Add Slack notification or email alert to the admin.

## Workflow Overview
This workflow automates the full subscriber management process:

1. Trigger: WordPress form submission
2. Check if subscriber exists
3. Add new subscriber via TWZ MailPoet API
4. Log subscriber data to Google Sheet
5. Optional: Notify admin via Slack
6. Show completion message to user

Use this workflow to streamline MailPoet subscriber automation.

nodes.name: Check If Subscriber Exists In MailPoet
Check Google Sheet for Existing Subscriber

main.node: Check Google Sheet for Existing Subscriber
Check If Subscriber Exists In MailPoet

user.name: Sergey Tulyaganov

With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
